p: On 21 June 2013, the first case of a human infection by an avian-origin H6N1 influenza A virus (A/Taiwan/2/2013, Taiwan2) was reported by the Taiwan Centres for Disease Control [ 21]. The Taiwan2 isolate was highly homologous to currently circulating chicken H6N1 viruses in Taiwan and had been generated as a result of interclade reassortment. The virus was also identified as LPAI due to the HA1/HA2 connecting peptide region (QIATR/GIF), lacking the multibasic amino acids.
